intro: Sarcanthus sororius, commonly known as the twinleaf or twin-leaf plant, is a herbaceous species native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its roots are often harvested for medicinal use, containing compounds with potential anti-inflammatory properties. Sarcanthus sororius thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
